intro: Noronhia obtusifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, white flowers and red, fleshy berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy appearance. Noronhia obtusifolia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
